benchmark_details.name: AbBiBench (Antibody Binding Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: AbBiBench provides a unified, biologically grounded evaluation framework for antibody binding affinity maturation and design by utilizing antibody-antigen (Ab-Ag) complexes as functional units.
benchmark_details.data_type: sequence data and binding affinity measurements

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark framework for evaluating models that predict and design high-affinity antibodies.

data.source: Curated datasets containing experimental binding affinity studies from public repositories.
data.size: 155,853 mutated heavy chain antibodies across 9 antigens

methods: Correlation analysis between model likelihood and experimental affinity
methodology.calculation: Correlation calculated between model likelihoods and experimentally measured binding affinities.
methodology.interpretation: Higher correlation indicates better model performance in predicting strong binders.
methodology.validation: Models evaluated using curated datasets of experimentally determined binding affinities.
